name: OpenProfile
tagline: OpenProfile is a free and open-source easy to use autobiography and biography creator written in Python.
body:
### Welcome to the OpenProfile project
![OpenProfile Logo](http://deavmi.github.io/OpenProfile/images/logo.png)
## Overview

### What Is OpenProfile?
OpenProfile is a free and open-source easy to use autobiography and biography creator written in Python.

### How Did This Become?
I wanted to learn [Python](http://python.org/) after I had gotten my RaspberryPi. So I started learning it. My first [Python](http://python.org/) project was [I-wantz-doges](http://deavmi.github.io/I-wantz-doges), a project for developer shits and lols, it wasn't a serious project, anyway I continued developing the [I-wantz-doges](htpp://deavmi.github.io/I-wantz-doges) application until I thought came to my mind, that thought was the idea of [OpenProfile](http://deavmi.github.io/OpenProfile).

## Screenshots
OpenProfile terminal interface
![OpenProfile terminal interface](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/5207740/1888072/170013b4-7a08-11e3-82f1-729afc904cd2.png)

The OpenProfile procedure
![The OpenProfile procedure](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/5207740/1888073/1703ba3c-7a08-11e3-959d-8bacb7e6d5be.png)

OpenProfile's list of commands to be used within the terminal
![OpenProfile's list of commands to be used within the terminal](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/5207740/1888074/17055efa-7a08-11e3-9c66-ac370e4fc5fb.png)

## Compatibility

OpenProfile should work on all machines since it is a interpreted program used within the [Python](http://python.org/) interpreter. Please check the [requirements](https://github.com/deavmi/OpenProfile/wiki/Requirements) page.

## Changelog

*  Please click the link below to view the changelog.

View the latest changelog [here](https://deavmi.github.com/OpenProfile/changelog/online_changelog.txt)

## Downloads

### Application

Please visit the [release page](https://github.com/deavmi/OpenProfile/releases) for a list of all the releases in the history of OpenProfile.

### Stable builds

*  There are currently no stable builds.

### Nightly builds

*  [Download OpenProfile v1.4.0.0 _for Windows/Mac OSX/GNU-Linux](https://github.com/deavmi/OpenProfile/releases/download/v1.4.0.0/OpenProfile.py)
*  [Download OpenProfile v1.3.0.0 _for Windows/Mac OSX/GNU-Linux](https://github.com/deavmi/OpenProfile/releases/download/v1.3.0.0/OpenProfile.py)
*  [Download OpenProfile v1.0.2.7 _for Windows/Mac OSX/GNU-Linux](https://github.com/deavmi/OpenProfile/releases/download/v1.0.2.7/OpenProfile.py)

### Source code

To download the latest source code please [click this link](https://github.com/deavmi/OpenProfile/zipball/master). Default format is ".ZIP" but you may choose to download a ".TAR" version of the source code [here](https://github.com/deavmi/OpenProfile/tarball/master).

## License

OpenProfile is registered under GNU's General Public License version three (GPLv3), your copy of the license can be obtained [here](http://gnu.org/licenses/gpl.txt).

## The software stack

* [OpenProfile](https://github.com/deavmi/OpenProfile)
* [OpenProfile Launcher (First Stage)](https://github.com/deavmi/OP-first-stage-launcher_windows)
* [OpenProfile Launcher (Second Stage)](https://github.com/deavmi/OP-second-stage-launcher_windows)

## Donate

If you would like to donate towards this project then please visit [this](https://deavmi.github.io/Deavmi/donate) page for information.

## Credits

*  Deavmi - [Website](https://deavmi.github.io/Deavmi) / [Twitter](http://twitter.com/deavmi) / [Send an email](mailto:tristankildaire@gmail.com)

Testers

Special thanks

*  Travis-CI
*  GitHub

## Feedback

For feature suggestions or bug reports please drop an email by me: [tristankildaire@gmail.com](mailto:tristankildaire@gmail.com)

## Support these projects and campaigns

[![Support the GNU/Linux project](http://deavmi.github.io/Deavmi/images/support-them/gnubanner-2.png)](http://gnu.org) [![Stop the Hollyweb! No DRM in HTML5.](http://deavmi.github.io/Deavmi/images/support-them/hollywebshare.jpeg)](http://www.defectivebydesign.org/no-drm-in-html5)
